definition: and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: Taylor looked daggers at Atticus, as if daring him to speak.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒法官對阿迪克斯怒目而視，似乎看他敢不敢說話。

sentences.english: She gave the rude man a glare.
sentences.chinese: 她對那個粗魯的男子怒目而視。

sentences.english: The insects glared at me again.
sentences.chinese: 蟲子們再次對我怒目而視。

sentences.english: The school Wei of other a few surplus towards Han Leng to glare at.
sentences.chinese: 其他幾個剩餘的校尉對着韓冷怒目而視。

sentences.english: The woman glared within the man after he shouted rudely at her.
sentences.chinese: 那男人野蠻地衝她大聲喊叫，她也怒目而視。

sentences.english: The members of Club Med no longer need to glower across the table at each other.
sentences.chinese: 聯盟成員國不再需要像以前那樣在談判桌上怒目而視。

sentences.english: But all stood there, men and women, and glowered at him.
sentences.chinese: 但是人們都站在那裏，對他怒目而視。

sentences.english: He glared at me like a bull at a red rag.
sentences.chinese: 他像公牛怒視紅布一樣對我怒目而視。

sentences.english: The teacher looked daggers at me, (with a) ruler in (his) hand.
sentences.chinese: 老師對我怒目而視，手裏拿著戒尺。

sentences.english: He puffed up and glared at the importuning questioner.
sentences.chinese: 他們站着互相怒目而視。

sentences.english: Charlie glowered when I asked him to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 我讓查理走上前來，他怒目而視。

sentences.english: I glowered up at the skull and nodded.
sentences.chinese: 我對着頭骨怒目而視，然後點了點頭。

sentences.english: They didn’t fight, but stood there glaring at one another。
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有打架，只是站在那裏互相怒目而視。

sentences.english: The flat tall and slender head lamp headlamp is glowering likely.
sentences.chinese: 扁平細長的大燈像在怒目而視。

sentences.english: Liu Hulan glared the enemy before her death.
sentences.chinese: 劉胡蘭臨死前怒目而視着敵人。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
